front.title: Tools for the Support of Network Virtualization and Slicing

abstract.t: Network virtualization or slicing is network management pertaining to treating different traffic categories in separate virtual networks, with independent resource, technology, and topology choices. This document reviews IETF technologies that can be useful for network virtualization, such as those in Internet, Routing, and OPS areas.

An understanding of what current technologies there exist and what they can or cannot do is the first step in developing plans for possible extensions. Nevertheless, it should be noted from the outset that there is a considerable toolset for at leas some of the tasks associated with virtualization or slicing.
